questions.question: Which class must a Java servlet extend to handle HTTP requests?

options: To represent the current JSP page
To provide access to the response writer
questions.answer: To provide access to the response writer

questions.question: What is the purpose of URL rewriting in servlets?
options: To manage session tracking without cookies
questions.answer: To manage session tracking without cookies

questions.question: What is the name of `<%= %>`?

options: To track user sessions across multiple requests
questions.answer: To track user sessions across multiple requests

questions.question: Which method of ServletContextListener is invoked when an application is initialized?
Which JSP directive is used to declare global variables and methods in a JSP page?
Which object allows JSPs to interact with the servlet context?
Which HTTP status code indicates that a resource is not found on the server?
What is the default session timeout of HTTP Session in minutes?
Which method is called to remove an attribute from a session?
What is the purpose of the `jspInit()` method in the JSP lifecycle?
options: To handle HTTP GET requests sent to the JSP.
To initialize the JSP page and allocate resources.
To clean up resources and finalize the JSP page.
To destroy the JSP page and release allocated memory.
questions.answer: To initialize the JSP page and allocate resources.

questions.question: Which implicit object of JSP is equivalent to the `this` variable of Java programming language?

Which XML element is used to configure session-related configurations in `web.xml`?
What is the purpose of a web container?
What is the default HTTP method used when submitting an HTML form?
Which of the following statements is true regarding the `include()` method in the RequestDispatcher interface?
options: It includes the response of another servlet or JSP within the current response.
It sends the request to a different servlet or JSP within the same web application.
It sends the request to a different web application.
questions.answer: It includes the response of another servlet or JSP within the current response.

questions.question: Which method of HttpSessionListener gives notification when a session is created?

options: To configure global settings accessible to all servlets
questions.answer: To configure global settings accessible to all servlets
